data.title: Microsoft, Sony, EA and others drop out of GDC due to coronavirus
data.text: The biggest games event of the year is under threat of being cancelled as Microsoft, Epic Games, Unity, Sony, EA, Facebook and Kojima all drop out.

data.title: Microsoft pulls out of Game Developers Conference due to coronavirus risk
data.text: Microsoft said it will not attend the Game Developers Conference in San Francisco due to the coronavirus outbreak.

data.title: Microsoft withdraws from GDC gaming conference over coronavirus concerns
data.text: Xbox-maker Microsoft announced today that it will not have a presence at the Game Developers Conference in San Francisco this year, highlighting concerns surrounding the coronavirus outbreak. The company made the announcement on its Game Stack Blog: After a close review of guidance by global health authorities and out of an abundance of caution, we’ve […]

data.title: Microsoft shares slip after warning of coronavirus hit to supply chain
data.text: Shares of Microsoft Corp  fell as much as 4% on Thursday after the company warned of weakness in its PC business due to a hit to its supply chain from the coronavirus outbreak, echoing similar statements from Apple Inc  and HP.

data.title: Microsoft Joins Apple, HP in Scrapping Outlooks on Virus
data.text: Microsoft Corp. became the latest tech giant to reduce its quarterly outlook based on the outbreak of a novel coronavirus.

data.title: Microsoft wants to invest in Indonesia data centers, says Indonesian president
data.text: Microsoft Corp is keen to invest in data centers in Indonesia which will soon make regulatory changes to facilitate the move, the country's president said after meeting with the software giant's CEO on Thursday.
